description: Coefficients of x^n/n! in the expansion of (1 - x)^x.
comments: It appears that a(n) is always positive for n > 9.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
formula: a(n) = Sum(k=0..n, (-1)^k * A008275(k,n-k) n!/k! ). - _Max Alekseyev_, Aug 10 2013a(n) ~ 2 * n! / n^3 * (1 + (17/2-3*log(n)-3*gamma)/n), where gamma is the Euler-Mascheroni constant (A001620). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Apr 21 2014
author: _Simon Plouffe_
